instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PP3V43_G3H: What is PP3V43_G3H? This is a typo of PP3V42_G3H When you see PP3V43_G3H, assume they meant to type PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_MANUAL_RST_L: What is SMC_MANUAL_RST_L? SMC_MANUAL_RST_L resets the SMC when low.   _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that was working yesterday just fine, left it plugged in to charge overnight and now no green light on charger. 
<SIGNAL>PP3V43_G3H</SIGNAL> is present
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is present
<SIGNAL>PPUBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is low at 8.13v
<SIGNAL>SMC_REST_L</SIGNAL> is way low at 1.014v
<RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> 30koms 

I'm thinking I've got a bad smc, even though I've replace it already. 
any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: if <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is low then smc wont turn on, so not a bad SMC. check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> resistance to gnd and <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> for any peculiarities

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: resistance to ground on pin5 of <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> 0.466kohms. pin4 <SIGNAL>SMC_MANUAL_RST_L</SIGNAL> is kinda strange at 2.7v, pin 8 is at 3.3v, pin6 is 3.41v, pin1 and pin3 at 3.42v, pin 7 at 3.42v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: Crap under SMC, SMC itself is most likely fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
i recalled the smc to only end up with the same issue. i ordered a donor board to replace the SMC, then got another one of these that came in with liquid damage.. so i fixed it got it running but fans on high. took that SMC off and put on this board, now the machine turns on and runs but fan on high i ran the diagnostics and had a couple issues show up( see picture). i guessing i probably have a bad smc from the second board. 

does this sound right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: I have seen the same thing and it did end up being the smc,  also double check the solder job is good on it sometimes the balls are just not seating good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message: Problem on <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_1_S0_SDA</SIGNAL> / SCL. Crap in J4002, bad SMC/soldering are the 2 most likely. Could be anything connected to this bus though.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issue
threads.message:
i did check j4002 really good under microscope. i just thinking that the same fan spin issue on 2 machines with the same SMC chip is kinda a common denominator. but won't know for sure until donor board arrives and hopefully has a good SMC. 

thanks for the help guys. I'll keep you posted.
